title: PCl5 equil. - graph of rate when Cl2 is injected

content.description:
Refer to the following.

PCl5(g) â‡„ PCl3(g)+Cl2(g)

PCl5(g) decomposes into PCl3(g) and Cl2(g) according to the equation above. A pure sample of PCl5(g) is placed in a rigid, evacuated 1.00L container. The initial pressure of the PCl5(g) is 1.00 atm. The temperature is held constant until the PCl5(g) reaches equilibrium with its decomposition products. The figures below show the initial and equilibrium conditions of the system.
content.question: Additional Cl2(g) is injected into the system at equilibrium. Which of the following graphs best shows the rate of the reverse reaction as a function of time? (Assume that the time for injection and mixing of the additional Cl2(g) is negligible.)

choices.label: Each option shows a graph with the horizontal axis labeled Time and the vertical axis labeled Reverse Rate. There is a point labeled C L 2 Added about one-third of the way along the horizontal axis.  Option A. A line begins on the horizontal axis at the point labeled C L 2 Added and curves steeply up and to the right. The line appears to level off after about half of the graphed time has elapsed.

Option B. A line begins about one-fourth of the way up the vertical axis and moves horizontally to the right. At the point labeled C L 2 Added, the line moves vertically up to the top of the graph area where it then curves gradually down and to the right leveling off above where the line started. The line appears to level off after about half of the graphed time has elapsed.

Option C. A line begins slightly more than one-half of the way up the vertical axis and moves horizontally to the right. At the point labeled C L 2 Added, the line moves vertically up to slightly below the top of the graph area where it then curves gradually down and to the right leveling off below where the line started. The line appears to level off after about two-thirds of the graphed time has elapsed.

Option D. A line begins slightly less than one-half of the way up the vertical axis and moves horizontally to the right. At the point labeled C L 2 Added, the line curves gradually up and to the right where it then appears to level off after about half of the graphed time has elapsed.

content.answer: Option B. A line begins about one-fourth of the way up the vertical axis and moves horizontally to the right. At the point labeled C L 2 Added, the line moves vertically up to the top of the graph area where it then curves gradually down and to the right leveling off above where the line started. The line appears to level off after about half of the graphed time has elapsed.
